alternative_parents.description: Inorganic salt compounds containing a sodium atom either in its ionic form or bonded to another atom (metal or halogen).
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic sodium salts

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic nitrides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds that contain the cyano group (-[C-]#[N+]).
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic cyanides

class.description: Inorganic compounds belonging either to the alkali metal hydrides, the alkali metal nitrides, the alkali metal oxides, or the alkali metal sulfides.
class.name: Alkali metal organides

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as alkali metal nitrides. These are inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest metal atom is an alkali metal.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest metal atom is an alkali metal.
direct_parent.name: Alkali metal nitrides

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest metal atom is an alkali metal.
subclass.name: Alkali metal nitrides

superclass.description: Compounds that contains both metal and non metal atoms.
superclass.name: Mixed metal/non-metal compounds
